metadata.dc:author: Varela, Daniel
Hlavnicka, Alejandro
Wainsztein, Néstor
Díaz, Fernanda
Leiguarda, Ramón
metadata.dc:description: The so-called stunned myocardium, defined as transitory myocardial contractile dysfunction, has been clearly demonstrated in diverse clinical situations. However, stunned myocardium related to ischemic stroke has been poorly identified. We describe two patients with diagnosis of acute ischemic stroke who developed eletrocardiographic changes, cardiac enzyme increasing levels and myocardial dysfunction secondary to abnormal cardiac wall motion. At the same time the patients developed acute lung injury with rapid resolution, perhaps as a consequence of neurocardiogenic components.
metadata.dc:title: Atontamiento miocárdico luego del accidente cerebrovascular isquémico.
[Stunned myocardium after acute ischemic stroke].
